page.title: 09RAF CROUGHTON - US BASE 1
page.content: MoD land at RAF Croughton houses units of the US Air Force. An RAF flying station was originally built on 694 acres from 3 farms. Buildings from Rectory Farm are still used on the base. The concrete taxiway from the flying days is now a perimeter road, and the fighter pens and other tracks and pads are still in existence. The USAF arrived in the 1950's in the role it holds today, communications. Since 1 Oct 1984, the major unit has been designated the 2130th Information Systems Sqn. They provide a comprehensive communications facility to US and NATO troops worldwide. The antennae, satellite dishes and conspicuous "golf balls" scattered on the original grass runway sites provide a distinctive landmark.
